subject: Ethics
title: Informed Consent History
description: A quick win: understand Informed Consent History.

hook.text: A surgeon removes your extra rib during routine surgery 'for your own good.' Legal? Not anymore.

buildup.text: For centuries, doctors decided treatment without asking. Patients were expected to obey.

discovery.text: The 1914 Schloendorff case ruled: every adult of sound mind has the right to decide what happens to their body.

twist.text: True consent requires understanding. Signing a form nobody reads isn't real informed consent.

climax.text: Today, informed consent means explaining risks, alternatives, and benefits in language patients grasp.

punchline.text: Your body, your choiceâ€”that's not a slogan, it's law.

quiz.question: What does genuine informed consent require?
options: Clear explanation of risks, alternatives, and benefits the patient understands
Just a signed form from the patient
